Key Match Events: The 3:24 stretch to start the second quarter proved crucial, with the Hornets missing their first four shots and turning the ball over three times, leading to a 13-2 run by the Cavs.
Post-Match Reflections: Hornets Head Coach Charles Lee: "I thought that we started a little slow, and when you’re coming on the road and playing a good team like that, they definitely make you pay for every mistake you make… But we’re fighting, we’re competing, we’re trying to find ways of having better offensive possessions so that it doesn’t continue to put as much pressure on our defense"
Miscellaneous Highlights: Nick Smith Jr. scored a season-high 18 points on 7-of-12 shooting from the field and 4-of-6 shooting from outside the arc, and also filled the stat sheet with five rebounds, two assists and a blocked shot in 20 minutes off the bench.
Others: The Hornets have now dropped 10-straight games, including six-straight on the road, and are 18-1 at home. Charlotte returns home for Pride Night on Tuesday, January 7 to take on the Phoenix Suns.
